org.forgerock.openam.sts.soap.token.validator.wss

Interface WSSValidatorFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WSSValidatorFactoryImpl

    public interface WSSValidatorFactory
    Defines the functionality necessary to produce instances of the org.apache.ws.security.validate.Validator instances necessary to perform validation of the SupportingTokens specified in the SecurityPolicy bindings protecting soap-sts instances. This will produce Validators necessary to validate x509 and UNT assertions. It will not produce the Validators used to validate OpenAM tokens, as this is done via custom interceptor providers registered with the CXF bus (non-standard tokens must be supported in this fashion).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.ws.security.validate.Validator getValidator(TokenType tokenType, ValidationInvocationContext validationInvocationContext, boolean invalidateInterimOpenAMSession) 

    • Method Detail

      • getValidator

        org.apache.ws.security.validate.Validator getValidator(TokenType tokenType,
                                                       ValidationInvocationContext validationInvocationContext,
                                                       boolean invalidateInterimOpenAMSession)
                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        tokenType - The type of token which the Validator will validate
        validationInvocationContext - The context in which the Validator will be invoked.
        invalidateInterimOpenAMSession - Whether the interim OpenAM session, produced as part of token validation, should be invalidated at the conclusion of the token invocation.
        Returns:
        The org.apache.ws.security.validate.Validator instance which can validate the specified tokenType
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the specified TokenType is not supported. Currently supported TokenTypes are USERNAME and X509
